captions.text: - You guys, I think I'm getting a pet.
Should I get a cat or a dog?

- [Left Man] Cat.
- [Right Man] Dog.
- You a dog person?

Okay, dog people are way
better than cat people.
- Cat people are better than dog people.
Dog people are conformists.
They're rule followers.

Cat people, on the other
hand, are more abstract.
They think outside the box
and are actually, statistically smarter.
- It is well known that
cat people struggle in social situations.
They are introverts.

Dog people, on the other hand,
are extremely extroverted

and can handle any situation
that comes their way.
- Yeah, picking up shit every day.

Yeah. At least my pet doesn't
shit in a glorified sandbox.
- Okay, okay. Good points.
The real problem here is
I don't wanna end up a crazy cat lady.

- Exactly. That's why
you should get a dog.
Dog people love the outdoors.
Cat people are just shut-ins.

Think about it. You have to
walk your dog every single day.
Dogs and dog people love companionship.
- Companionship is overrated.
Think about this for a second.

You have to walk a dog
and pick up its poop
every single day.
Cats and cat people, on the other hand,
value affection more than anything else.
They love you when they need to.
They don't when they don't.
It's quality versus quantity.
- Yeah. A nice quality layer of cat hair
all over your beautiful black clothes.
(gasp)
- Dogs eat shoes.
- That is not fair.
- Actually, you know what?
My ex-boyfriend was a dog person.
He was kinda mean.
- That makes sense.
Studies show that women find cat people
nicer than dog people.
- You can have nice because,

statistically, cat people
are way more neurotic.
- Okay, but owning a cat
lowers your levels of anxiety and stress.

- So, basically, you're
saying that as a cat person,

you need a cat because
you're a neurotic mess.
- It doesn't matter! They balance you out.
It's like having a friend.
- So, wait, are you saying, like,
I'm your cat?

- I don't know. Does
that make me your dog?

It's like maybe, cat people
and dog people need each other?
- I think I'm gonna get a fish.
- Fish people are the worst.
They're basically a decoration.

- It lives in a cocktail
of its own food and feces.
- What about a bird?
- Something designed to fly,
you're gonna keep caged its whole life?

- Yeah, is that gonna make
you feel good about yourself?
- Okay. I don't care what you guys say.
I'm gonna get a fish.

I'm actually allergic
to all animals anyway.

comments.text:
Personally, I have continued to have bad experiences with cats and I have 
grown up with dogs, We used to have 2 rottweilers and People were terrified 
of them even though they were the nicest dogs alive (Hyperbole, don't take 
it seriously) One time my grandma was at my dads work and a man with a 
walking stick came in, One of the dogs came and started to lead my grams 
inside, away from the walking stick, so anyone who says a particular dog 
breed is violent, It all comes to the owner, I am a dog person, I just 
cannot see a good side to cats other than cuteness. This is my personal 
opinion.﻿
comments.author: MakeupTitan

comments.text:

just come to me for affection and have never shown me any affection. Keep 
in mind this is my experiences and opinions﻿

comments.author: Viola Meinander

comments.text:
As a person with 5 dogs, dog hair sticks to everything no matter what color 
thing so screw the whole "cat hair on black clothes, ew" things because I 
need to brush my carpet every 3 days otherwise it looks like an albino bear 
on the floor. Thank god for tiled floors. I used to have 2 cats who died of 
natural causes and I can say I am completely a cat person and I love going 
out with friends and being active. My sister is an introvert but she's also 
a dog person, though I take care of the dogs more than she does.﻿

comments.text:
Reports say that, on average, when a human dies and nobody knows (for 
example, old man with no family dies and it takes a long time for anyone to 
notice), their cat wait about four days until eating their human out of 
hunger. Dogs, in the other hand, have gone months and months- ripping up 
carpets, opening fridges, pantries, and when that's all gone, sometime 
seven starving to death- before resorting to eat their owner's dead body. 
Usually, they simply give up and die alongside their deceased owner. ﻿

comments.text:
I preferably like cats, but I don't hate dogs. Dogs are nice too. There 
used to be this girl in my class. She was a dog person.(not saying all dog 
people are like this. I bet there are cat people like this too...) She said 
she HATED cats. I don't know why. She said that they were ugly and mean. 
She annoyed the hell out of me be doing that!!! I once overheard her saying 
to a person "Did you know cats can kill people?" I wanted to smack her in 
the face!!!! Honestly, I've never heard of a cat killing someone. I'm 
pretty sure dogs could kill people too!! Cats might not be your thing, but 
no need to hate on them!!!! Dogs aren't exactly my thing, but I never 
complain or hate on them!!!!! I hate people who do that. Sheesh.﻿
